    • Method Detail

      • parseSources

        public static List<org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit> parseSources​(org.eclipse.jdt.core.IJavaProject project,
                                                                          org.eclipse.jdt.core.ICompilationUnit[] compilationUnits,
                                                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
        Go for a full parse+load into memory, with Binding resolution activated for the set of sources. This one pass parse ensures that IBindings resolve to a single instance in memory for a given object therefore we can lookup and store IBinding easily in the code (hash, equals, == all OK).
        Parameters:
        project - input Java project carrying important classpath/JLS version etc...
        compilationUnits - The set of input files we are considering as our scope.
        monitor - a progress monitor, just forwarded to the parser.
        Returns:
        a set of fully resolved and parsed JDT DOM style document model for Java AST. We can use "node.resolveBinding()" in the resulting CompilationUnit.
